meanings.def: a small piece of paper, cloth, plastic, etc. attached to something to identify it or give information about it
examples: He put name tags on all his shirts.
a gift tag (= tied to a present)
The washing instructions are on the label.
Everyone at the conference had to wear a name tag.

meanings.def: an electronic device that can be attached to a person, animal or object so that police, researchers, etc. know where the person, etc. is
examples: The police use electronic tags to monitor the whereabouts of young offenders on probation.

meanings.def: a name or phrase that is used to describe a person or thing in some way
examples: They are finally ready to drop the tag ‘the new Beatles’.
The president made several jokes in an attempt to shake off his ‘humourless’ tag.

meanings.def: a word or phrase that is added to a sentence for emphasis, for example I do in Yes, I do
a set of letters or symbols that are put before and after a piece of text or data in order to identify it or show that it is to be treated in a particular way
a short quotation or saying in a foreign language
examples: the Latin tag ‘Si vis pacem, para bellum.’ (= if you want peace, prepare for war)

meanings.def: a children’s game in which one child runs after the others and tries to touch one of them
a symbol or name used by a graffiti writer and painted in a public place
to fasten a tag onto something/somebody
examples: Each animal was tagged with a number for identification.
The containers were tagged with colour-coded labels.

meanings.def: to attach an electronic device to a person, animal or object so that the police, researchers, etc. know where the person, etc. is
examples: Persistent young offenders will be electronically tagged in a scheme to cut youth crime.

meanings.def: to give somebody/something a name that describes what they are or do
examples: The country no longer wanted to be tagged as a Third World nation.

meanings.def: to add a set of letters or symbols to a piece of text or data in order to identify it or to show that it is to be treated in a particular way
to add a link to various users' profiles from a photo on a social media website
examples: If you upload a photo, people can tag the people in it.
The site lets you tag and share photographs.

meanings.def: to leave a name or mark on a piece of graffiti to show who made it
examples: Graffiti artists started tagging and painting entire subway trains.
